title: Looking for a rioter
body: almost before 3 weeks i got suspended for 14 days because i joined a game (Odyssey) mode.. the rest was a premade of 4.. they wanted to do mission with 2 augments.. told them from pick screen i don't need that quest but the one with 3 augments.. so, we joined the game.. they could surrender easily (cause i would 100% press yes if they ff) and go onto the next one or find a 5th premade so they can do whatever quests they wanted to do.. the fact is i was clear to them from pick screen.. but what did they do? they prefered right after we joined the game start all flaming at me, wishing me cancers (note that i've lost 3 members from that sickness) & slaughter to my family.. that triggered me in a very bad way.. so we were 2 groups.. one of a solo guy and another of 4 premades flaming at eatch other.. someone will say that you could mute them.. ofc i could.. like i did with countless other kids like them.. maybe it just happened to wake up in a bad mood? the fact i've lost members cause of that sickness triggered me badly that day.. i accepted my punishment and waited patiently for the suspend to go off.. before couple of minutes i joined a ranked game with 2 duos.. camille at top with our jungler zac, vayne adc with our mid irelia.. enemy jungler kayen literally got his sleeping bag at bot and dived us all the time.. camille started flaming at us nonstop (zac also but this game didn't talk too much so he is not much of an issue), so i told her "shut your mouth garbage.. this is why i hate duos" and then asked on /all chat from enemies to report camille for flame.. ps: kayen before we write on /all chat praised me and vayne.. he said to our team to honor us, because we deserve it.. maybe cause we stayed cool and didn't flame.. also said that we are unlucky to have those teammates.. so i wonder if it's fair to get perma banned on a account, which i've spend so much time & money on it since season 2, because i told to a nonstop flamer "shut up garbage"?

No, I don't think that makes any sense. 

It's bad for the game to allow people to flame. A system that makes exceptions has more opportunity to be misinterpreted. What constitutes flaming? When has someone gone too far over the line that you are justified in talking back?

The mature response is to mute and report. Riot shouldn't be expected to sanction your retaliation. It wouldn't solve anything to have a system like that; you'd just have a bunch of flamers claiming that they were justified in flaming, and it would amplify the problem.

No one likes getting banned. The current system incentivizes you to shape up. If you don't, you get banned. You're either part of the solution or part of the problem. There's not a lot of grey area here.

The mute button is a perfect defense for this, as is defense that is *actually* defense rather than a counter-attack. Neither of those will get you punished. No amount of "Yeah, I'm just having a bad day and am playing League to relax. Sorry I'm not doing so well this game, but I'm trying my best. Muting you now." will get you punished.

>...and I am going to tell you if someone was telling you to kill youself, that your dumb, trolling you (idk throwing popcorn at you), or anything else in a movie theater that you would not sit there and take it, and I am sure the people around you would/should back you up.

It's happened to me before -- not at a movie theater, but in a similar venue. I asked the fellow politely to stop once, a bit more aggressively once, and then quietly addressed the issue with management without making a scene when that failed to solve the problem. He was removed promptly, and I suffered no fallout as a result. HAD I made a scene myself, however, I'd have absolutely faced some sort of consequence, even if just a warning.

Once? No. Multiple times? Debatable. Multiple times over multiple games? Now it's a habit that may be a problem. Really I'd need to see the chat log. A lot of stuff is okay in small amounts but not in large amounts.

The system is not always instant, nor always perfect, nor is every punishment a ban. Some behaviors are not swiftly caught and escalated to a 14-day ban or permanent ban, but it's still possible that the individual in question received a chat restriction or points towards a future punishment.

>before you go blubbering put that brain in use first..

Your belief either way does not ultimately change how the system works, alter its general reliability, or impact the times when it fails to do its job.
